title: Strike out the response
applicationTitle: Strike out all or part of the response
content: You can request that the tribunal strike out all or parts of the response.
If something is ‘struck out’ it is removed from the claim or response and cannot be relied upon.
The tribunal can strike out all or parts of the respondent's response on their own initiative or after a request from the claimant.
A strike out request must be based on at least one of the grounds of Rule 37 of the Employment Tribunals Rules of Procedure, which is when:
• the response is scandalous, vexatious or has no reasonable prospect of success
• the proceedings have been conducted in a way that is scandalous, unreasonable or vexatious
• the respondent has not complied with tribunal orders or the Rules of Procedure
• the response has not been actively pursued
• it is no longer possible to have a fair hearing
Details to include in your application:
• why you think the response should be struck out
• which ground or grounds in Rule 37 you say applies in your case
• if you are referring to numbered points or paragraphs in a respondent's response, include these numbers or other references
